name: 林彥良
objective: This course is expected to expand students' writing capacity and experience by helping them to formulate, organize, and present ideas clearly in well-formed paragraphs and compositions. Students will learn about rewriting, outlining, paraphrasing, synthesizing, documenting, note-taking, writing the draft and editing their own work.
schedule:
Week 1  Course Introduction
Week 2  The Writing Process
Week 3  Introduction to the Paragraph I 
Week 4  Introduction to the Paragraph II
Week 5  Refining Grammar Skills
Week 6  The Narrative Paragraph I
Week 7  The Narrative Paragraph II
Week 8  Writing Practice & Review
Week 9  Midterm Exam
Week 10	Refining Grammar Skills 
Week 11	The Descriptive Paragraph I
Week 12	The Descriptive Paragraph I I
Week 13	The Expository Paragraph I
Week 14	The Expository Paragraph II
Week 15	Introduction to the Essay I
Week 16	Introduction to the Essay II
Week 17	Writing Practice & Review
Week 18	Final Exam
scorePolicy:
Class Attendance & Participation: 20%
Midterm & Final Essays: 40%
Quizzes & Assignments: 40%
materials: Smalley, R. L., Ruetten, M. K. & Kozyrev, J. R. (2012) Refining Composition Skills. Boston: National Geographic Learning.
